com.viaoa.comm.multiplexer.io

Class VirtualSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.Socket
      • com.viaoa.comm.multiplexer.io.VirtualSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class VirtualSocket
extends Socket
    A "virtual" socket connection to an MultiplexerServerSocket through a multiplexed connection. A MultiplexerSocket is created and managed by MultiplexerSocketController, so that the input and output streams are able to share the real socket.
    Author:
    vvia

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int _connectionId
      Real socket connection id (assigned on server)
      protected int _id
      unique identifer (assigned by MultiplexerSocketController)
      protected Object _lockObject
      Lock used when waiting to perform a read on the real socket.
      protected String _serverSocketName
      Name of server socket.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected VirtualSocket(int connectionId, int id, String serverSocketName)
      Called by MultiplexerSocketController when creating a new socket or receiving a command to create a new virtual socket.

      • getConnectionId

        public int getConnectionId()
        The ID that is assigned on the server to the real socket connection.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        The ID that is assigned by MultiplexerSocketController. This is assigned during the constructor, and is a sequential number.

      • getServerSocketName

        public String getServerSocketName()

      • read

        public abstract int read(byte[] bs,
                         int off,
                         int len)
                  throws IOException
        Used so that the real socket is used for the vsocket read. MultiplexerSocketController will implement these methods and then manage access to the "real" socket.
        Throws:
        IOException
